message: one thing that would probably make sense for it to do is to use base64. CouchDB uses base64 for attachments (though they can also be accessed and saved as binary http data).
I just restarted a project I hadn't touched for a couple months: a site called jsonista.com where I try and build tools and domain-specific languages for json
for one thing, I think that the essence of json-enabled apps is that things can be json, not that they are json

for instance, if mongodb had a solid mapping from bson ↔ json, I would contend that it speaks json as fluently as couchdb, even though the internal representation isn't json, and apps can be built without ever serializing to json
I think a big part of the essence of json is being transparent. If you read the spec on http://json.org/ and pretty print any JSON document, you know pretty much exactly how it works.
